instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance – this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.PLT_RESET: What is PLT_RESET? PLT_RESET stands for platform reset. When this is asserted the machine will not POST. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

liquid damage to SMC area, SMC reset chip and clock chip area.
Had no green light.
Replaced SMC reset chip, reflowed SMC. Now get green light and PPBUS is 12.56v

Now get quarter fan spin


Replaced <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>
replaced Y2805
replaced caps etc in that area

no change.

Checked CPU Vcore. It is not pulsing on with fan spin.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> is present

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP>

pin1 3.3v jumps
pin2 12.46v jumps
pin15/24 5v jumps
pin 20 jumps all over, difficult to tell but above 2v
pins 21/22/23 0v
pin40  0.25v jumps

so i am lost.

Not sure if this is clock related or should be looking more at <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. I think that Vcore should pulse with the fan spin.

Grateful as always for any help.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
1) Resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

2) Is there a short on any S0 rail(do not call vcore a short)? <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, etc. 

vcore should pulse with fan spin so its lack of pulsing is a bad sign.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
Thank you Louis.


1. <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

pin 17-18 2.8ohm
pin 27-28 20.3ohm


2. S0 rails not jumping to correct voltage (all others present)

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> jumping but only to around 0.2v
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> only jumps to 0.02v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> 0v
diode mode on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0.398v drop to ground.

checked <TRANSISTOR>Q7860</TRANSISTOR>
pins1,2,3 (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>) first jump high - like seems to jump to 10v (can that be right) then went to 0v
pins ,5,6,7,8 (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>) jumps only to 0.2v
<RESISTOR>R7862</RESISTOR> + <RESISTOR>R7860</RESISTOR> measure 150k over all but lower resistance than expected so ignore.

So it seems <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is missing. Checking <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>

pin3 2v (??)
pin13 (en) 3.4v
pin16 12.56v
pin17 5v
pin20 - seems like it jumps to 10v - ??
pin23 - jumps to 3.4v

Tried replacing <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> but no change.


Tried lifting L7260,
Diode mode pin2 is 0.120v, pin1 is 0.48v (v similar to other board).
So its a problem with generation.

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR> / <TRANSISTOR>Q7261</TRANSISTOR>
Diode mode now matches other board, but still same quarter fan spin.

Thanks for any help you might give!

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
WHAT! I asked for resistance to ground on S0 rails and you replace <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>? WHY??? I do not need all this information, just information requested. :( Replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR> makes no sense since we have no reason to believe it is bad yet.

Answer my question and as punishment for providing all this unnecessary info and replacing <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, check for shorts on every s3 rail too. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>, etc.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
Sorry Louis.

Resistance to ground S3 rails.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 20.3k 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 19.8k
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> 115ohm 
<SIGNAL>PPVTTDDR_S3</SIGNAL> 25.1k
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL> 113ohm

Resistance to ground S0 rails

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 29.5k
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 8.8k
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> 295ohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> 14.68k
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> 157k
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 33ohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 22.1ohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCADPLL</SIGNAL> 1.25k
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 9.3ohm
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> 10.8ohm
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL> 21.5ohm

Thank you.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
This one won't be easy by any means.

Does <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulse with fan spin?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
Hi Louis,

Yes. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> does pulse.

I checked a lot of things. The only things that looked odd were:

1. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> jumping but only to around 0.2v (which sent me on my <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> journey as it appeared to be the only rail not jumping to the voltage it should be)

2. <SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN</SIGNAL> is missing and not jumping. Although <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is jumping (so for <RESISTOR>R3210</RESISTOR> i get jumping 3.4v at pin 1 but 0v at pin 2).

3. May be related to 2 but PLT__RESET_L is a steady 0v and does not jump. I get a flash of voltage on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R3202</RESISTOR> (too fast to read only get a lightning bolt on my fluke)

appreciate the help.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses high then all rails are fine including <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>. <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> checked?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message:
Hi Duke thanks for the reply.

<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> measures fine, voltages correct either side. (12.56v/12.46v)
<RESISTOR>R7401</RESISTOR> also measures fine.

is 0v (not jumping) on PLT__RESET_L and <SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN</SIGNAL> worth investigation or should they come up after Vcore ?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET</SIGNAL> will only be released after Vcore has come on. At this point it could be anything, most likely is crap under SMC or PCH, or corroded trace/resistor.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message: Was the bios chip (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP>). Donor chip boots all the way through - was literally last thing i was going to do before donoring it no signs of damage either. Some ME fuckery to do but can mark this as solved! thank you both for your help.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter fan spin - yay!
threads.message: ME needs fixing! Upload original dump to be fixed!
